title: Tower of Basel: The Shadowy History of the Secret Bank
description:
Adam LeBor, "Tower of Basel: The Shadowy History of the Secret Bank that Runs the World"
ISBN: 161039254X | 2013 | EPUB

Tower of Basel is the first investigative history of the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most secretive global financial institution. Based on extensive archival research in Switzerland, Britain, and the United States, and in-depth interviews with key decision-makersÃ¢â‚¬â€including Paul Volcker, the former chairman of the US Federal Reserve; Sir Mervyn King, governor of the Bank of England; and former senior Bank for International Settlements managers and officialsÃ¢â‚¬â€Tower of Basel tells the inside story of the Bank for International Settlements (BIS): the central bankersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ own bank.

Created by the governors of the Bank of England and the Reichsbank in 1930, and protected by an international treaty, the BIS and its assets are legally beyond the reach of any government or jurisdiction. The bank is untouchable. Swiss authorities have no jurisdiction over the bank or its premises. The BIS has just 140 customers but made tax-free profits of $1.17 billion in 2011Ã¢â‚¬â€œ2012.
